intro: Erythranthe hardhamiae, commonly known as the Hardham's fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has small, ovate leaves with ciliate margins and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
